changes.shortDesc: Time Tracking Enhancements – improved flexibility and smoother tracking experience.

subChanges.shortDesc: Additional time entry formats: Time can now be entered in decimal format (e.g., 1.5h = 01:30:00).
Comments section: Add comments directly in the Time Tracking page and upload them to Oracle with task descriptions.
Uninterrupted time tracking: After editing an entry, tracking will resume once it is saved.

changes.shortDesc: Usability Improvements – quality-of-life updates for a more intuitive experience.

subChanges.shortDesc: In-line editing: Double-click on a field to edit, then press Enter to save.
Description text box: Pressing Enter saves your input instead of creating a new line.
Fuse shortcut for shared AVD: Now available in the Start menu and not removed by monthly maintenance.
To pin Fuse: Go to Start menu → Right-click on Fuse → More → Pin to taskbar. (Do not pin the running taskbar instance.)
Billing manager layout: Action buttons and header panel are now fixed at the top.

changes.shortDesc: Data Management Enhancements – cleaner data handling for improved clarity.

subChanges.shortDesc: Upload entries by Project Code: Helps maintain order and organization.
Zero-hour days now appear as blank instead of zero in Oracle.
Streamlined task setup: Selecting a project in Time Tracking auto-displays Project and Task Code fields.

changes.shortDesc: Your data’s got a fuse-proof vest now – even if your browser cache goes poof, your Fuse data stays put.

subChanges.shortDesc: Auto-backups now every 5 minutes – because time waits for no one, but we’ve got your billing data on a short leash.
Billing manager data and user settings now included in backups – all your setup and sanity, secured.

changes.shortDesc: Accidental wipe? No worries. Fuse can now restore your tracked time, billing manager data, and user settings in one clean sweep.
Time zone trouble? Fixed. You can now set your preferred time zone right in the app instead of depending on your device’s moody behavior.
Play/pause all day, any day – you can now control any timesheet whether it’s in the past or the future.
